header: A Year as a Web Developer

data.text: January 6th, 2020, the day I started my journey with Ayoka Systems. It would be the first time I worked at a tech company in the US. I went into the office dressed up and nervous. Upon arrival, I was put at ease when I met four other new interns. We were presented with documents to fill up and soon after learned about the culture of the company from the HR Manager.

We were given a warm welcome and had someone walk us through the development process and workflow. Before I knew it, I was was working on projects with tens of thousands of lines of code. I was using technology I had never used before. I was designing documentation for projects that would go on for years.

It was overwhelming at first, but as I got used to the tech stack, and the patterns, everything started to make more sense. I was growing at an exponential rate and was learning all sorts of new things. One specific week I was assigned the task of building upon an existing dashboard with VueJS, a framework foreign to me at that time. By the end of that week, I had earned myself the title of Top Developer.

About four months into my internship was when the pandemic struck. Ayoka was quick to respond and transition online. Both remote and in-person, I felt like I belonged and had a blast working through new problems every day.
The time I spend at Ayoka, and with the team will be a time I look back on and cherish. Now more then ever, I'm excited to graduate and embrace what my career holds for me.
Check out my social media (or resume).
